intro: Tetranthera nitida, commonly known as the slender tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Tetranthera nitida is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
